heroTitle: How Archon engages: design, integrate, and govern specialized agents.
heroLede: Clear roles, constraints, and outcomes—plus observability and evaluation—so teams can trust automation.
heroNote: We start with a scoped plan (roles, risks, success metrics) and move into a governed pilot before scaling.
whatDesign: Role discovery workshops, decision trees, and constraint maps. We define success metrics before any code is written.
whatIntegrate: Data, tools, and workflow integration with observability dashboards and evaluation harnesses to keep agents measurable.
whatAdvisory: Build-versus-buy calls, governance patterns, playbooks for rollout, and implementation support from MVP to production.
engageItem1: Discovery and role definition workshops to align scope and success criteria.
engageItem2: Pilots with narrow surfaces and measurable outcomes to prove reliability early.
engageItem3: Integration into data, tools, and workflows with guardrails and observability.
engageItem4: Ongoing evaluation, audits, and governance reviews to keep systems trusted.
cadenceCopy: Weekly checkpoints, shared playbooks, and transparent criteria for expanding scope.
cadenceNote: Teams know what is in scope, how agents are measured, and when to scale.
whereStrategy: Clarify where agents fit, what to automate, and how to measure impact before build decisions are made.
whereDesign: Translate strategy into scoped pilots with explicit roles, boundaries, and success checkpoints.
whereImplementation: Integrate into systems with evaluation harnesses, logging, and recovery paths to keep risk low.
whereOperations: Establish governance rituals, runbooks, and audits so agents remain predictable as they scale.
flowStep1Copy: Align on objectives, risks, and where agents add value.
flowStep2Copy: Define responsibilities, constraints, and escalation paths.
flowStep3Copy: Launch a narrow surface with evaluation and observability.
flowStep4Copy: Connect to systems with logging, alerts, and governance gates.
flowStep5Copy: Expand scope with audits, runbooks, and change control.
timeline1Copy: 1–2 weeks to map roles, constraints, and measurable objectives. Outputs: role canvas, risk map, pilot plan.
timeline2Copy: 4–6 weeks to deliver a scoped agent with evaluation and observability. Outputs: pilot agent, dashboard, runbook.
timeline3Copy: Progressive expansion with governance gates and simulation where needed. Outputs: integration plan, escalation playbooks.
timeline4Copy: Monthly audits, tuning, and change management to keep agents aligned with business rules.
